The kernel uses algebraic simplification to reduce the number of arithmetic operations.
The kernel reduces index calculation complexity by avoiding full-dimensional coordinate decomposition.
The kernel groups channel-wise computations to improve memory access coalescing.
The kernel is compiled with --use_fast_math to enable hardware-optimized approximate operations.
The kernel eliminates redundant memory accesses by removing duplicate tensor inputs.
The kernel improves cache locality through batch-aware channel grouping of computations.
The kernel minimizes register pressure through operation fusion and reduced intermediate steps.
